about_the_game:
The Story

Bedtime Stories is a 2D platformer where you ward off evils as the heroes in a fairytale world of the bedtime stories told by two struggling parents. Three parallel timelines unfold as each parent takes turns telling their tales, reflecting their journey to reconcile their cultural differences. As the heroes in these stories triumph with the help of allies rather than powerful weapons or artefacts, the parents are reminded of the importance of people over their rigid beliefs.

Ward off Evil Creatures and Banish them from our Realm!

Evil creatures inspired by traditional Indonesian theatre puppet show as well as Cantonese theatre puppet shows are lurking in every corner! Defeat them to reach the mythical artefacts for more power!

Carefree Combat with No Death Penalty

There is no death penalty and only a cool-down for healing. All the enemy will knock you back, but they can all be defeated by one hit. Try to finish the level as quickly as you can! Or just go through the level slowly to soak in the beautifully hand-drawn environments.

Make Allies Along the Way

A friend in need is a friend indeed! The allies will fight along you and increase your stats!

Experience the Wholesome Family-friendly Story

Follow along as the young family overcomes minor frustrations that arise from parenting differences, and celebrates common ground and everyday kindness across cultures.

Features

  • Cozy, care-free combat in imaginary worlds.

  • Forgiving platforming and combat with no death penalty.

  • Non-verbal game with music and sound effect but not voice acting, where parents can read out the story like a book.

  • Mystical Artefacts that you can collect

  • Rescue allies to join you on your adventures

  • Fusion music inspired from traditional Cantonese as well as Indonesian instruments

  • Heart warming story of growing up in a mixed-cultured family

short_description: Bedtime Stories is a wholesome 2D platformer with fun, forgiving combat where you play as the imaginary heroes in Cantonese and Indonesian fairytales. Face creatures inspired by Traditional Puppet Theatre, only to realise that the allies you form along the way are much more powerful.
